result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Submit an apology to victim in way and manner to be determined by agent. DE may not possess or consume alcohol nor possess or consume any controlled substances unless they have been prescribed by a physician and then may only be taken exactly as prescribed in the manner and form prescribed.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin L. Krueger

defendant.name: Krueger, Benjamin L.
defendant.address: N13995 Divine Rapids Road, Park Falls, WI 54552

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives right to attorney.   DE enters plea of GUILTY to all counts.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Comments by DA. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:45 am. 
Court imposes: 
Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions:
$350 fine
AODA
Apology
Defendant may not consume or possess alcohol nor possess or consume any controlled substances unless they have been prescribed by a physician and then may only be taken exactly as prescribed in the manner and form prescribed.

Defendant may not have violent contact with Danielle Krueger. Defendant may not have contact with Bo Krueger, Dennis Carpenter, Lori Meritt, Jeremy Kammerude, unless there is written consent on file. Defendant shall not consume any alcohol. Defendant may not possess or consume any controlled substances other than one lawfully prescribed and in the amounts, frequency and in the manner prescribed. Defendant is subject to any/all conditions ordered in bond filed in 07-01-14 in 14CM43.

Plaintiff, District Attorney, Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 10-28-14 at 10:00 am. Court gives DE notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. DA moves to forfeit bond in 14CM43 and have one bond for both cases. So ordered. Comments by Court and DE. Ruling by Court. Bond to include conditions from 14CM43 and new conditions.
